definition: appellee (side that won in trial court, whose victory is being appealed by losing side)

quilt/by/(indicates passive-voice clauses)/(literary) to cover/to meet with/(coll.) (since c. 2009) used before a verb that does not accurately represent what actually happened, to describe with black humor how sb or sth was dealt with by the authorities (as in 被自殺|被自杀[bei4 zi4 sha1])
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: To order the cost to be borne by the Appelle.
sentences.chinese: 判令被上诉人承担本案诉讼费用。

definition: another case (in law)/a case to treat separately
judgment (by a court of law)/to pass judgment on/to sentence
to argue (that)/to allege/to dispute/to plead (e.g. not guilty)
to be qualified (to bring a complaint, lawsuit etc) (law)
(law) legal representative of a corporation (e.g. chairman of the board of a company, principal of a school etc)
